title: Citi Field Kids Program Returns for Third Season to Provide Children in New York City Communities with Motivational and Educational Experience
summary: New York – Citi will hold its first Citi Field Kids program for the 2011 season when the Mets host the defending World-Champion San Francisco Giants on Thursday, May 5, at 1:10 p.m. at Citi Field.
tag-1: Citi Field Kids Program Returns for Third Season to Provide Children in New York City Communities with Motivational and Educational Experience
tag-3: New York – Citi will hold its first Citi Field Kids program for the 2011 season when the Mets host the defending World-Champion San Francisco Giants on Thursday, May 5, at 1:10 p.m. at Citi Field.
tag-4: Mets' General Manager Sandy Alderson will be the guest speaker while SNY anchor and reporter Michelle Yu returns for a second season as Master of Ceremonies.
tag-5: Additionally, Wes Moore, Citi Vice President in the Institutional Clients Group, will share his inspiring story with the kids in attendance. Moore is the author of the acclaimed New York Times best-seller The Other Wes Moore: One Name and Two Fates—A Story of Tragedy and Hope, which chronicles a generation of boys trying to find their way in a challenging and at times, hostile world.
tag-6: "I am proud to work with Citi Field Kids to provide deserving students with a unique and educational experience," said Moore. "It is rewarding to share my story with kids who are facing the same challenges that I did. I hope they will feel empowered to make choices that will improve their own lives and communities."
tag-7: Now in its third season, Citi Field Kids is an educational and motivational community-based initiative for New York City middle- and high- school students developed by Citi in collaboration with the Jackie Robinson Foundation, United Neighborhood Houses of New York and the Mets. Citi Field Kids was launched on April 15, 2009 in conjunction with Major League Baseball's annual Jackie Robinson Day.
tag-8: The series of in-season events has sought to positively impact students through the nine values and ideals of Jackie Robinson, the legendary pioneer and great American trailblazer who broke baseball's color barrier with the Brooklyn Dodgers in 1947. The "nine values" he embodied – courage, integrity, determination, persistence, citizenship, justice, commitment, teamwork and excellence – serve as a focal point of the Jackie Robinson Rotunda at Citi Field to advance and perpetuate Jackie's humanitarian ideals.
tag-9: Said Dave Howard, Executive Vice President, Business Operations, New York Mets: "The Citi Field Kids program is one of many community initiatives that are vital and integral to our partnership with Citi. We have been honored to host, in conjunction with Citi, these middle- and high-school students at Citi Field to help provide a unique and profound learning experience."
tag-10: Each Citi Field Kids visit begins with a pre-game tour of the Jackie Robinson Rotunda led by former Jackie Robinson Foundation Scholars. The program on Thursday will also include a presentation by Jackie Robinson Scholarship alumnus Asia Dorsey, who attends NYU and is studying Sociology and Environmental Studies.
tag-11: Participating in the program's third season are students from the 38 nonprofit organizations that make up the United Neighborhood Houses (UNH) federation of settlement houses and community centers. For 90 years, UNH and its nonprofit members have been improving the lives of New Yorkers in the five boroughs by providing social, educational, and recreational services for people of all ages. UNH works specifically with youth across New York City to advocate for important programs such as the Summer Youth Employment Program, while the nonprofit members provide programs such as afterschool and summer camp, arts workshops and education, leadership training and recreation of all types – all designed to support them in becoming successful adults.
tag-12: "The Citi Field Kids program is a wonderful opportunity for young people involved with member agencies of United Neighborhood Houses to learn about Jackie Robinson's inspiring journey from the Jackie Robinson Foundation Scholars, as well as to have a great time at a major league game" said Nancy Wackstein, Executive Director, United Neighborhood Houses of New York. "Our kids are tomorrow's leaders, and it is wonderful that the Mets and Citi both are investing in their futures as part of a solid commitment to New York City."
tag-13: Each participant in the Citi Field Kids program will receive a complimentary gift bag with items provided through the courtesy of promotional partners Modell's Sporting Goods and MISSION, the first and only line of Athlete-EngineeredTM products designed to enhance PERFORMANCE in and RECOVERY from training and competition.
